topic.title: HPE Helion 2.0 Development Platform: Upgrading HPE Helion OpenStack to Version 2.1

body.p: When upgrading HPE Helion OpenStack from version 2.0 to 2.1, shutting down the VMs that run the control plane will also stop the services that make up the HPE Helion Development Platform. Additional procedures, if any, required to bring each service back online are provided here.

section.title: Application Lifecycle Service
section.p: After rebooting the compute nodes, if any ALS clusters do not restart, perform the following steps.

body.p: The first designate-stop playbook stops a designate component which automatically restarts before the databases become available again. Once the other playbooks have been run, that component is safely restarted.
Bring up the messaging control plane.

ol.li: SSH into the HPE Helion OpenStack lifecycle manager. ssh stack@<hos-deployer-ip>
From the HPE Helion OpenStack lifecycle manager, SSH into the Messaging deployer node. This was created during installation of the Messaging service.ssh stack@<messaging-deployer-ip>
Navigate to the ansible scratch directory. cd scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible/

Run the following playbooks in this order. ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts FND-CLU-start.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts percona-bootstrap.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts cue-start.yml

section.note: If you did not previously deploy any RabbitMQ clusters, this step does not apply to your environment.

ol.li: SSH into the HPE Helion OpenStack lifecycle manager. ssh stack@<messaging-deployer-ip>
From the HPE Helion OpenStack lifecycle manager, SSH into the Messaging deployer node. This was created during installation of the Messaging service.ssh stack@<messaging-deployer-ip>
Navigate to the ansible scratch directory. cd scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible/

Run the RabbitMQ cluster recovery script.
Copy this codeblock into a plaintext file and save it as cue-rabbit-fix.sh
Copy the script file into this directory on the messaging deployer. /home/stack/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible
Make the script executable. chmod +x cue-rabbit-fix.sh
Execute the script to bring all your RabbitMQ clusters online../cue-rabbit-fix.sh
